entries.title: Dan Bongino said that he is stepping down as deputy director at the FBI, after a nine-month tenure in which he clashed with both Justice Department leadership and the bureau’s workforce
President Trump on Tuesday received and discussed a draft copy of a book by lawyer Alan Dershowitz that studies whether Trump could constitutionally serve a third term as commander in chief
Four vulnerable House Republicans revolted against Speaker Mike Johnson and backed a Democratic effort to force a vote on extending ACA subsidies
The Senate passed the sweeping defense-policy bill, despite lawmakers’ pushback on one aviation-safety issue and the Trump’s administration approach to European security
FCC Chair Brendan Carr told a Senate oversight hearing that the agency isn’t independent, contradicting a description that, until then, had been featured on the commission’s website
Rep. Dan Newhouse, one of 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach President Trump in 2021, said he won’t run for re-election next year in his conservative Washington district

A group of Democratic senators is asking the Justice Department to explain why federal law enforcement never interviewed Jeffrey Epstein’s longtime lawyer or in-house accountant when they investigated his sex-trafficking scheme
The IRS is mounting a novel attack on Meta’s international tax maneuvers, seeking $16 billion in connection with tens of billions of dollars in profits booked in Ireland
A federal appeals court on Wednesday allowed President Trump to continue deploying National Guard units on the streets of Washington, D.C., at least temporarily
Rising jobless rate under Trump has some precedent, and it often ain’t pretty. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:
The Senate majority leader said Congress won’t be able to extend federal health-insurance subsidies before leaving for the holidays, punting any possible fix into the new year
If GOP Rep. Nancy Mace is going to win her race for South Carolina governor, she’s going to do it mostly on her own
President Trump, in a WSJ interview, conveyed uncertainty about whether the GOP would keep control of the House in the midterms because some of his economic policies have yet to take full effect
Mike Lindell, a staunch supporter of President Trump, is running to be Minnesota’s next governor
Democrat Eileen Higgins’s victory in the Miami mayor’s race Tuesday marked a rebuke of President Trump in the heart of a community that has become a nerve center of his movement.
Two progressives competing in the Democratic primary for the U.S. Senate are raising Texas Democrats’ hope that the party could win a statewide race next year.
The Pentagon won’t release the full, unedited video of a lethal Sept. 2 strike on alleged drug traffickers, said Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth
A tech-savvy law-enforcement officer wrote a new computer program that finally deciphered critical information in the Jan. 6 pipe-bombs case
Here is what is in the $901 billion defense-policy bill passed by the House
A “terrifying” new era of warfare is forcing America to rethink its tools and tactics as it prepares for great-power conflict with China
A group of seven Democratic U.S. senators is pushing back on President Trump’s decision this week to allow Nvidia to sell its H200 AI chips in China
